citeinfo.title: Changes in Anthropogenic Influences on Streams and Rivers: Atmospheric Deposition

descript.abstract: This dataset contains average watershed precipitation-weighted (wet) annual mean ion deposition of nitrogen (N), calcium (Ca), chlorine (Cl), magnesium (Mg), and sulfate (SO4), for the years 1985-2012, for Hydrologic Unit Code 10 (HUC-10) areas. Wet ion deposition for each watershed was calculated from annual mean ion deposition from approximately 2.3 kilometer resolution raster digital data from the National Trends Network (NTN), National Atmospheric Deposition Program.
descript.purpose: These data are intended to provide a framework in which watershed-specific studies of water quality in streams and rivers may be analyzed. The focus of the data is on anthropogenic changes over time.
descript.supplinf: Five comma-separated text files are given here: one for each of the five parameters noted in the abstract. Each text file here contains a "uniqid" field, which is the link to the data in all other datasets in this product. Each file has 15,458 rows. For five records data were filled with 0 because the source rasters did not extend to those HUC-10s. These were all coastal HUC-10s, for example the southern tip of the Florida Keys. The unique ids for these five records are 4259, 9162, 9448, 9551, and 13172. HUC-10 boundaries were obtained on January 9, 2018 from the U.S. Department of Agriculture (USDA) National Resources Conservation Service (NRCS) at https://nrcs.app.box.com/v/huc/folder/39640323180 (National Resources Conservation Service, 2017). References: National Atmospheric Deposition Program (NRSP-3), 2017, NADP Program Office, Illinois State Water Survey,University of Illinois, Champaign, IL 61820, available at http://nadp.sws.uiuc.edu/NTN/. National Resources Conservation Service, 2017, Watershed boundary dataset (WBD): National Resources Conservation Service, U.S. Department of Agriculture, available at https://www.nrcs.usda.gov/wps/portal/nrcs/main/national/technical/nra/geo/, accessed January 9, 2018 from https://nrcs.app.box.com/v/huc/folder/39640323180.

dataqual.logic: No formal logical accuracy tests were conducted.

horizpa.horizpar: A formal accuracy assessment of the horizontal positional information in the data set has not been conducted.

vertacc.vertaccr: A formal accuracy assessment of the vertical positional information in the data set has either not been conducted, or is not applicable.

srcinfo.srccontr: HUC-10 boundaries used in data calculations.

citeinfo.title: National Trends Network, National Atmospheric Deposition Program

srcinfo.srccontr: Source raster digital data from which watershed mean annual wet ion deposition was calculated.

procstep.procdesc: (1) Ion deposition rasters were downloaded from http://nadp.sws.uiuc.edu/NTN/annualmapsByYear.aspx, for each year 1985-2012, for each of the five elements or compounds listed in the abstract (N, Ca, Cl, Mg, and SO4)

(2) Source data were in .tif format, and already in the project's Albers projection. For ease of processing, the .tif's were converted to ESRI Arc Grid format. Spatial resolution of the grids was 2338-meters.

(3) HUC-10 watershed mean annual atmospheric deposition was calculated using the zonalmean() command in ArcGIS Grid. For five records data were filled with 0 because the source rasters did not extend to those HUC-10s. These were all coastal HUC-10s, for example the southern tip of the Florida Keys. The unique ids for these five records are 4259, 9162, 9448, 9551, and 13172

enttyp.enttypl: Attribute Table for atmospheric deposition data
enttyp.enttypd: Data consist of comma-separated text files. There are 5 tables: atmos_dep_ca-huc10.txt, atmos_dep_cl-huc10.txt, atmos_dep_mg-huc10.txt, atmos_dep_n-huc10.txt, atmos_dep_so4-huc10.txt
enttyp.enttypds: Surface Water Trends project, USGS National Water Quality Program

attr.attrdefs: Unique integer ID used for internal processing and for linking data from other tables for HUC-10 data

attr.attrdef: Annual mean atmospheric wet deposition of nitrogen (N) in units of kilograms per hectare, for year XXXX (1985-2012)
Annual mean atmospheric wet deposition of calcium (CA) in units of kilograms per hectare, for year XXXX (1985-2012)
Annual mean atmospheric wet deposition of chloride (Cl) in units of kilograms per hectare, for year XXXX (1985-2012)
Annual mean atmospheric wet deposition of magnesium (Mg) in units of kilograms per hectare, for year XXXX (1985-2012)
Annual mean atmospheric wet deposition of sulfate (SO4) in units of kilograms per hectare, for year XXXX (1985-2012)
